text: [Music]
hi I'm Amy of the traveling together
journal along with my husband Matt and
dog cheddar we have been consistently
using this lifesaver jerrycan 20,000 UF
water filter while we Overland through
Mexico and Central America for the last
400 days we are not sponsored by a
lifesaver we just feel like this was a
fabulous purchase before we left and
after over a year on the road we still
think it's a fabulous purchase and we
wanted to share that with you
this jerrican holds 4.9 gallons of water
and can filter over 5,000 gallons of
water with just one filtering element
the filter is rated to remove 99.999% of
bacteria 99.99% of viruses and 99.9% of
parasitic cysts that's some clean water
in order to give this review some
context I feel it's necessary to briefly
mention the three alternative solutions
we considered for obtaining clean
drinking water while long-term / landing
through Mexico and Central America where
it is known not to have clean drinking
water from the tap number-15 potable
water along the way number two buy
potable water along the way and carry a
backpackers filter for emergency use and
remote use number three install a
built-in water filtration system with
tanks pumps and plumbing similar to what
is in an RV with all these other viable
solutions why do we choose the lifesaver
jerrycan for our clean water needs we
wanted a solution that was convenient
cost-effective environmentally friendly
and durable convenience the lifesaver
Giri can does not require any
installation like a built in system
would it is easy to use you just simply
fill it Pump It and pour it it takes
less time to filter an equal amount of
water as a back packers filter wood you
can carry the jerrican to a water source
if you can't drive to it avoiding a
potential issue that someone with a
built in system may have you can take
advantage of non potable water sources
like rivers lakes wells and water
catchment systems this will allow you to
stay in more remote locations for a
longer period of time unlike if you're
purchasing your water cost-effectiveness
this is a 20,000 leader Gerry camp and
it costs between 200 and 250 dollars it
is a bit of an initial investment
compared to buying your water along the
way it is definitely on par price-wise
with most backpacker filters and it is
definitely cheaper than most built-in
systems the key for us is not initial
cost but the cost over a long period of
time and in comparison to the other
options we considered this jerrican has
saved us a lot of money I have
calculated that our family of three two
people in one dog will consume at least
three gallons of water per day and in
Mexico the average price of water is 50
cents per gallon so that equals a dollar
fifty per day if we chose to buy all of
our water along the way that is five
hundred and forty seven dollars and
fifty cents for a year we've been on the
road for over a year so that means we've
already saved over $300
now this jerrican can filter over five
thousand gallons of water with one
filtering unit and in that year we will
have only used a little over 1,000
gallons so we still have plenty of years
left on this jerrycan to continue saving
us money environmentally friendly you
will save a lot of plastic bottles by
having a life saver jerrycan even if you
are really really good and making sure
you always refill your own bottles at
refills
you will find times where that's just
not an option you will also likely spend
lots of fossil fuels looking for these
refill stations when you could have just
taken the lifesaver Giri can and filled
it at a free pump at a grocery store or
a gas station that you were going to
stop at anyways durability this Giri pan
is made of a thick durable plastic and
all of its mechanisms are simple and
durable there are no electronics so if
something does break it is easy to fix
criticism of the Giri camp this jerrican
is not perfect I'm gonna share with you
a couple of things that have happened
over the course of the year and how we
went about fixing them at one point our
pump was leaking and our spigot had
broke I wrote the company and they got
immediately back to us and so far our
experience with customer service is that
they are really great the customer
service representative had wrote to me
to tell me about a little black piece at
the bottom of the pump that was very
easy to remove and build up collects on
it causing the pump to leak we cleaned
the little black piece put it back in
and the pump stops leaking we have had
to do this two or three more times in
the last year but every time we do it
the pump stops leaking so it's a very
simple easy fix and as far as the spigot
the company sent us a brand new one and
I will say that the new one has lasted
longer and does feel a bit more durable
being the original one something that I
did not know when I purchased this
jerrycan is that the actual water filter
only lasts three years after you open it
and use it so from my previous
calculations with how much water of my
family's life drink per year we will
actually drink 20,000 liters of water
within three
here's all that really ends up meeting
is that we're not stingy with our water
we do our kisses with filtered water we
shower with it and we share it with
others that we eat along the way the
water filter inside is remain wet that
has not been a problem for us because we
are consistently filling it with more
water but if you are going to be in a
situation where you can't immediately
fill it with more water you will make
sure you leave just enough water to keep
the filter moist at all times otherwise
you would risk damaging the filter
extras we chose to buy a couple extra
features and we would like to share
those with you because we're happy with
the choice we purchased a flexible
shower hose that easily attaches to the
bottom of the jerrycan and all you do is
pump it up and because it is pressurized
you do not have to actually have satiric
an elevated to get water out of it the
pressure is not fantastic but it is a
lot better than trying to use a solar
shower that you have to elevate and also
has terrible pressure you can also
locate it wherever you actually need it
to rinse the soap off these carbon
filters last twenty five hundred liters
those water they are easy to install
but can be obtained to remove got it you
will need the plan on topping the first
five liters of water that are filtered
with each new carbon filter because
small amounts of carbon will be emitted
into the water although this is not bad
for your health
it isn't that pleasant conclusion we are
very happy we chose this life saver
jerrican as our drinking water solution
as we overland through Mexico and
Central America and we would highly
recommend this jerrican as a solution
for over landing long terms to areas
where potable water is not readily
available and free
